column5: Jaundice is when your skin and the whites of your eyes turn yellow.It's harmless in newborns
Make sure its not hungry#Comma sick and the diapers are changed.
Babies need to eat a minimum of 8 to 12 (or more) times in 24 hours.
Expressing milk means squeezing milk out of your breast so you can store it and feed it to your baby later.
You can express milk by hand or with a breast pump
You can store breast milk in a sterilised container or in special breast milk storage bags in a fridge
All that depends on your baby's needs.Some babies want frequent short feeds#Comma and others prefer feeding for longer  or a mixture of the two.
Exclusive breastfeeding (breast milk only) is recommended for around the first six months of your baby's life
Breast milk has very important nutrients necessary for child development
It is adviced to breastfeed for six months and then can stop anytime after the six months.
They may get restless,suck their fist or fingers#Commamake murmuring sounds#Comma turn their head and open their mouth (rooting)
Press the heel of your hand gently but firmly on your breast when this happens.Wearing breast pads will stop your clothes becoming wet with breast milk
There's no right or wrong way to stop breastfeeding.It could happen gradually as you start introducing solid food.
You may notice that Sucking slows down or stops#Comma you no longer hear swallowing#Comma baby’s arms and hands relax.
You need to breast feed frequently#Comma bond with the baby skin to skin#Comma avoid taking harmful substances and feed well.
